title: Scale Trip
description: ScaleTrip pushed me deeper into backend development by designing and building with Python and FastAPI, a RESTful API with full authentication from scratch. I modeled relational data with PostgreSQL and implemented core CRUD operations. The project strengthened my understanding of API design, data modeling, and writing maintainable backend code.

title: Status Tracker
description: Status Tracker challenged me to quickly debug a persistent 500 error in an unfamiliar codebase. I traced the issue to outdated dependencies and improved error handling, learning GraphQL, Prisma, and Next.js on the fly. The project sharpened my backend skills and taught me the value of robust debugging and clear communication.

title: GuavaFi Website
description: GuavaFi needed a fast, engaging website to showcase their product. I built from a figma design, a user-friendly interface, then adapted quickly when the timeline was cut short. This project taught me to prioritize features, streamline my workflow, and deliver quality under pressure while keeping user experience central.

title: FoodBank Admin Portal
description: I built an admin dashboard for FoodBank where admins manage food loans, distributions, user roles, and finances. This project deepened my skills in role-based access, secure data handling, and user-friendly UI. I learned the importance of planning, real user testing, and used charts to help admins quickly understand distributions.
